newsitem.title: UK: British Coal sells CIN Property to US company.
newsitem.headline: British Coal sells CIN Property to US company.

text.p: British Coal said it has agreed the sale of CIN Property Management Ltd to La Salle Partners International, the UK subsidiary of Chicago-based property firm La Salle Partners.
The deal marks the final step in the transfer of all British Coal's pensions related activities to the private sector.
La Salle has agreed terms with the trustees of the two coal pension schemes for the management of the schemes' property assets. The core holding is 17 shopping centres spread throughout the UK.
The terms of the sale have not been disclosed.
The holdings also include a tower block near Oxford Circus in London's West End shopping district, plus the St James Shopping centre in Edinburgh.
After the deal La Salle will have some $14 billion of property assets under management.

British Coal said the agreements between the trustees and La Salle for the management of the property assets had been approved by the Secretary of State for Trade and Industry Ian Lang in his capacity as guarantor of the schemes.
